intro: Excoecaria camettia, commonly known as the red torch tree, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking red, pendulous flowers that bloom in clusters, giving it a dramatic appearance. The plant has thick, waxy leaves that are typically dark green and glossy. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and as a houseplant.
